instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
Device arrived with complaints Audio is out. Reported new headphone jack and speakers.
System report  AUDIO output says "Devices" and box is blank.
Sound settings show no output devices. Volume slider and mute box greyed out. Mute is checked
Slider on display and touch bar volume buttons function correctly.
Safe mode generates no difference.
U6200 and u6300 replaced to rule out still no change.
Could this be software related?



Device is on Big Sur. After weekend when trying to login normal device encountered a problem stating critical update needed and fails.

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
Try first disconnecting webcam.
ALS failure can cause critical update error.

Just in case. check U6360 output voltage.

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
disconnected Display and used external monitor. Fails update. IS there another way to disconnect webcam?

btw
u6360 
pin 1: PP1V8_S0_LDO_AUD "input"   1.8v
pin 2: GND_AUDIO_CODEC                   0v
pin 3: L83_LDO_EN  "output"             3.2v
pin 4: 3V3_S0_AUD "output"              3.2v
pin 5: GND_AUDIO_CODEC                   0v

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
1V8 output is good.

Be sure U6300 gets all voltages; check L6300-2.

Audio codec not recognized, should mean there is a problem with U6200.
Check its resistors and traces to PCH.

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
U6300
PP1V8_S0_LDO_AUD, C6301,L6300,L6301 - 1.8v
PP3V3_S0, L6302, 3.294V

U6200 Has many resistors. Is there any in particular? I2C,ASP_CLK etc?

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message: Look at the left side "To PCH" marked lines...

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
R1310  HDA_BIT_CLK , .907v
R1311 HDA_SYNC, .20v
R1312 HDA_RSTL , 1.795v
R1313 HDA_SDOUT , 0v

Checked twice. Yesterday and today values remain same

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message: These resistors have correct ohm values?

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
You meant 33 ohms I hope.

Did you also check R6203?
You can have bad U6200, or solders/traces.
Even bad PCH is possible.

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message: R6203 climbs to "0.012v" and then back to 0v. 33 ohms.

threads.title: 820-00928 No audio - High fan - Slow/sluggish
threads.message:
Do you still get critical update error message?

You should try known good BIOS.
Just in case, to discard BIOS upgrade failure.
